intro: Wendlandia caroliniana, commonly known as the Carolina rainflower, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a red or purple throat. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The foliage is typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, hairy textures, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
